snippet: Republicans’ tired remedy for rising gas prices won’t fix anything. President Obama’s measures have a far better shot at lessening this country’s dependence on oil imports and keeping prices under control.
abstract: Editorial asserts that, contrary to what Republicans have been saying on the campaign trail, rising gas prices are not due to a lack of American production; argues that gas prices are rising largely due to forces beyond America's control, and that Pres Obama's policies have a far better chance of reducing the country's dependence on foreign oil and keeping prices under control.
lead_paragraph: Republicans’ tired remedy for rising gas prices won’t fix anything. President Obama’s measures have a far better shot at lessening this country’s dependence on oil imports and keeping prices under control.
